sub_title: Personal Home tutor to students of Havo/vwo & Vmbo-T at Self-employed private tutor
summary:
Experienced and enthusiastic Special Needs and Inclusive Education with Psychology graduate, with a 9 year track record of working with children. This experience has encompassed: child-minding; nanny; babysitting; assisting children with English as a second language; LSA (Learning Support Assistant) for children with Autism and a personal tutor to a child with SEN. 

Safaa has successfully completed two years as an LSA within a Resource Base Unit for children with Autism, in a Mainstream school in London. Here she has specialised in teaching children with Autism on a one to one level and in a group of five guiding other LSAs. In core academic subjects, including: maths; reading; writing and others. Also, catering to the children’s physical, emotional, behavioural and learning needs. 

Highly organised with good admin and positive communication skills which have enabled Safaa to forge productive working relationships with parents and teaching colleagues. A Strong team player, being able to manage and delegate to others and take on responsibility, extremely flexible allowing Safaa to work under pressure and be confident in the presence of her colleagues and other professionals. Furthermore, Safaa is experienced in Makaton signing, was appointed to manage and resource the TEACCH Zone and to deliver a variety of lessons, including oral, gross and fine motor skills.

school.name: University of East London School of Education and Communities

education.field_of_study: Special Educational Needs and Inclusion WITH Psychology

courses.name: Cambridge English Level 5 Certificate in Teaching English Speakers of Other Languages

profile_positions.description: Lesson plans, educational targets and achievement according to end of year English exam for Havo/vwo & Vmbo-T. Planning the teaching sessions, gathering resources for the lesson, carrying out the teaching session, preparing for end of year English exam, assessing progress with Vmbo-T end of year exams, target setting for progress, liaising with parents on progress and new targets for achievement and being open minded and respecting parents’ wishes.
profile_positions.title: Personal Home tutor to students of University, HBO, MBO, HAVO/VWO and VMBO-T.

profile_positions.description: Being a special nanny to a child with Autism and their neuro-typical sibling, I had to schedule and coordinat their activties with breaks, keeping organised, undertake appropriate educational activities with the children, take full responsibility of the children’s safety when left with me, preparing nutritious meals and snacks, assisting with self-care and hygiene, installing good manners and a sense of responsibility, creating a learning table to complete homework, implementing sensory breaks, meeting the children’s social, emotional and physical needs, creating situations to promote socialising between siblings, using Makaton to support speech between myself and the child with Autism, using positive reinforcement to promote and encourage learning, creating resources to encourage and support learning, completing homework with both children individually, providing age appropriate activities, advising and supporting parents with their child’s development, consistently keeping parents up-to-date on their children, sticking to the children’s bedtime schedule and creating a calm and soothing environment at bed time.
profile_positions.title: nanny/babysitter for a child with and a child without Autism

profile_positions.description:
I supported a child with Down syndrome and Autism, home schooling programme by tutoring him at home once or more a week, from an hour to two hour sessions. Alongside another tutor, who I would consistently liaise with. As, she too was focusing on his P-levels for Reading, Writing, Maths and Speech and language.  

As, a Personal tutor I had to plan the teaching sessions according to his targets, gather the resources for the lesson, carry out the teaching session, include sensory breaks, collect evidence for proof of achieved targets (photos, video and transcript of conversation between myself and child), liaise with other tutor on targets that have not yet been met and new targets to be focused on and discuss any concerns parent may have, advise them on how they can support their child's learning, behavioural and emotional needs and consistently promoting positivity and confidence on what an amazing job they are doing with their child.
profile_positions.title: Personal home tutor to child with SEN
Learning Support Assistant for children with Autism

skills: TEACCH ('Treatment and Education of Autistic and related Communication handicap)
